channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report X-2025051877
item.description:
Report X-2025051877

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Michael Walker, 086 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1814 spill on the trailer floor and yard. Michael Walker advised the pallet stacked with jugs not in cases. Michael Walker stated the pallet was forced under a beam, and when the forklift operator pulled the pallet out the jug s fell resulting in the spill. Michael Walker advised it appears the freight was already leaking before attempting to move the freight. Safety advised Michael Walker due to the spill be hazardous and on the yard, Safety will contact CURA for remediation. Kailee Mason with CURA was contacted for reme diation.

item.title: Report E-2025050413
item.description:
Report E-2025050413

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 16, 2025, four (4) 32-ounce cans of Weld-On C-65 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and degreaser to remove the released product from the dock floor. The damaged cans of product and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050308
item.description:
Report E-2025050308

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 14, 2025, one (1) 30-pound box of Super Shockwave Shock Treatment was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental (HE) to remediate the site. The crew containerized the damaged box in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All released material was collected with hand tools and containerized in the same (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050098
item.description:
Report E-2025050098

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-05
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 5, 2025, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN2014 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the site. The crew secured the loose cap for further shipment of the product. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 5-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050088
item.description:
Report E-2025050088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: HINESVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS USA, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50223
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 07:30 AM Eastern Time the Airgas National Carbonation driver was stopped at a RailRoad Crossing in Hinesville GA when she was rear ended by a third party driving a Red Bull delivery truck. There is damage to the the ANC vehicle #308713 to the extent that it will need to be towed, and the damage to our truck has caused the tank to leak. At this moment the ANC driver is saying she is not injured but HV Care has been contacted as a precaution. The driver of the Red Bull vehicle is saying he is not injured.
